text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Double gold glory for our tennis heroes at the Pan Arab Games.
- Harmony and honeyed words at the economic summit but still not a single detail.
- Israel's public security minister Kahlani says he's ready to meet Syria's President Assad on Lebanon.
- Economic summit breaks up in disarray.

- Leading banks announce strong profit growth. Banque Audi 's net profits rose 18.7 percent to 17.02 billion pounds in the first half of 1997 over the same period last year. Banque Beyrouth pour le Commerce posted a 190 percent rise in full year 1996 net profits to 6.36 billion Lebanese pounds.
- U.S. Secretary of State Albright leaves Washington without making a decision on Lebanon travel ban.
- Israeli planes fly over Beirut and Baalbek. Three South Lebanon Army militiamen wounded in Hizbollah attack.
- The Baalbek festival opens tonight with the Caracalla Dance Theatre.
